title: Happy families
text: Justayellowbadge said: Bluedot said: Horrible example of the 'where there's a blame' culture these days, no such thing as an accident I think people may be underestimating the ordeal this poor woman has been through. Seriously, if you can read harrowing testimony like 'I was at a party in Manhattan recently and it was a bit difficult to hold my hors d'oeuvres plate' without thinking 'Christ, she deserves at least a Range Rover out of this' then you have no soul. Some one said it right with inheritanceReading between the lines I reckon she feels she got significantly less than she thought she was entilted to after her sister died - I am not saying it is right at all - but I doubt she genuinely felt the injury required compensation on its own merits - it was just an excuse to get the trustees in court,
